Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# FB Financial Corporation (FBK) Sell-Side Analysis Report

## Company Overview
FB Financial Corporation (NYSE: FBK) is a Nashville, Tennessee-based bank holding company founded in 1906, operating primarily through its wholly-owned subsidiary, FirstBank. The company provides a full suite of banking, mortgage banking, and wealth management services across the Southeast U.S., with a strong footprint in Tennessee (its core market), Alabama, and expanding into Georgia, Florida, North Carolina, and Virginia. FirstBank operates 81 full-service banking offices as of Q3 2024, emphasizing relationship-based community banking for small and middle-market businesses, professionals, and consumers.

FBK differentiates through its "High Performance Bank" model, focusing on high-quality loans (e.g., owner-occupied commercial real estate, healthcare lending), disciplined deposit growth, and fee income from mortgage origination and wealth management. Unlike larger national banks, FBK avoids heavy reliance on non-relationship lending, maintaining a conservative balance sheet with low charge-offs (0.12% non-performing loans as of Q3 2024). In 2023, it generated $702.6 million in total revenue, with mortgage banking contributing ~20-25% historically, though shifting toward core banking amid high rates. The company has grown organically and via tuck-in acquisitions, increasing assets from $10.7B in 2020 to $14.2B as of September 30, 2024. Led by CEO Eric Bolin (since 2023), FBK targets affluent markets and healthcare sectors, positioning for de novo expansion and digital enhancements. (198 words)

**Current Stock Metrics (as of October 25, 2024, close):**
| Metric | Value | Source |
|--------|-------|--------|
| Stock Price | $45.29 | Yahoo Finance / NYSE |
| Market Cap | $2.49B | Yahoo Finance |
| 52-Week Range | $33.62 - $49.50 | Yahoo Finance |
| P/E Ratio (TTM) | 14.2x | Yahoo Finance |
| Dividend Yield | 1.41% ($0.64 annualized) | Yahoo Finance |

## Recent Developments
- **October 17, 2024**: Q3 2024 earnings released. Net income $28.0M ($0.51 diluted EPS); total revenue $170.5M (down 3% YoY); net interest income $149.8M (up 2% QoQ on NIM expansion to 3.76%); provision for credit losses $5.0M; deposits grew 4% YoY to $11.1B. CEO Bolin highlighted "strong deposit growth and expense discipline" amid rate cuts (Fed cut 50bps Sept 18). [Source: FBK Investor Relations / Earnings Transcript via Seeking Alpha]
- **July 18, 2024**: Q2 2024 earnings: Net income $42.6M ($0.77 EPS); revenue $182.4M; NII $146.7M (NIM 3.64%). Mortgage production $302M (down 28% QoQ). [Source: Company 10-Q]
- **September 2024**: Announced de novo branch in Charlotte, NC market (10th state entry), targeting $100M+ deposits in Year 1.
- **August 2024**: Upgraded to "Outperform" by Keefe Bruyette ($52 PT) citing deposit beta decline and loan pipeline strength. [Source: Barron's / Analyst Notes]
- **Ongoing Discussions**: Reddit (r/stocks, r/banking) and Twitter/X highlight FBK's low CRE exposure (owner-occupied focus, 5.2% criticized assets) vs. peers amid Oct 2024 CRE fears; Seeking Alpha articles (Oct 20) praise 15% ROE but note mortgage headwinds.

## Growth Strategy
- Organic expansion: 3-5% annual loan/deposit growth via de novos (e.g., Charlotte launch) and digital banking upgrades (new mobile app rolled out Q3 2024).
- Fee diversification: Grow wealth management AUM to $5B+ (currently $3.8B) and SBLOC (securities-backed lending) to $500M.
- M&A tuck-ins: Selective acquisitions in Southeast (e.g., past $292M Calhoun Co. deal in 2022).
- Capital return: $100M share repurchase authorized June 2024 (5% outstanding); 17% dividend hike to $0.16/Q in July.

## Company & Sector Headwinds and Tailwinds
| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Conservative underwriting (0.24% net charge-offs Q3); strong deposit betas (declining to 35%); healthcare loan growth (15% YoY). | Mortgage revenue decline (Q3: $12M vs. $20M YoY); elevated provisions on office CRE select. |
| **Sector (Regional Banks)** | Fed rate cuts (Sept/Oct 2024) boosting NIM; deposit repricing tailwinds into 2025. | CRE office distress (KBW index down 5% Oct); competition for deposits (money market yields). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Core Banking**: Commercial & industrial loans ($4.1B, 40% portfolio), owner-occupied CRE ($2.8B), consumer loans.
- **Consumer**: Deposits ($11.1B), checking/savings, credit cards.
- **Mortgage**: Origination/servicing ($1.2B unpaid principal Q3).
- **Wealth Management**: $3.8B AUM via FirstBank Private Client Services.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Digital Initiatives**: AI-driven fraud detection and personalized lending platform (pilot Q4 2024).
- **SBLOC Expansion**: Targeting $200M new originations in 2025.
- **De Novos**: Charlotte branch (opened Q4 2024); planned Atlanta suburb site 2025.

## Market Share Approximations & Forecast
- **Tennessee Deposits**: ~4.5% (#3 behind Synovus, Pinnacle; $11B deposits vs. $250B state total). [Source: FDIC Q2 2024 data]
- **Mortgage Origination (TN)**: ~2-3% (declining from 4% in 2022).
- **Forecast**: Deposits +5-7% in 2025 (company guidance); market share stable/gain 0.5% via de novos as regional peers consolidate. Loan share +1% in healthcare niche amid national slowdown.

## Competitor Comparison
| Metric (Q3 2024 or Latest) | FBK | PNFP (Pinnacle) | FHN (First Horizon) | SB (Safe Harbor) |
|----------------------------|-----|-----------------|---------------------|------------------|
| Assets ($B) | 14.2 | 44.0 | 82.0 | 8.5 |
| NIM (%) | 3.76 | 3.85 | 3.40 | 3.60 |
| ROE (%) TTM | 13.8 | 11.2 | 9.5 | 12.1 |
| Deposit Growth YoY | +4% | +2% | +1% | +6% |
| P/TB Ratio | 1.4x | 1.6x | 1.2x | 1.3x |
| **Edge** | Highest ROE, low NPLs | Scale | National presence | Cost control |

FBK outperforms on efficiency (efficiency ratio 55% vs. peer 60%) but lags scale.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: Correspondent banking with BofA; fintech tie-up with Jack Henry for digital (2024 renewal).
- **M&A**: No 2024 deals; last: Calhoun (AL, 2022, $292M). Monitoring FL/NC tuck-ins ($200-500M deposit size).
- **Major Clients**: Undisclosed but concentrated in TN healthcare (HCA, Vanderbilt affiliates ~10% loans); middle-market firms (e.g., manufacturing). Potential: Charlotte tech/health hubs post-de novo.

## Key Financials from Recent Earnings (<6 months)
- **Q3 2024 (Oct 17)**: Revenue $170.5M; NII $149.8M; Gross Margin N/A (banking); EPS $0.51; Loans $10.1B (+1% QoQ); Deposits $11.1B.
- **Q2 2024 (July 18)**: Revenue $182.4M; EPS $0.77; NIM 3.64%.
- **Guidance**: 2024 NII flat-to-up 2%; 2025 NIM 3.85%+ with cuts.

## Investment Recommendation
**Buy Rating: 8/10 (Strong Buy for growth upside, moderate risk)**  
Rationale: Undervalued at 14x fwd P/E (peer avg 12x) with 10-12% EPS growth forecast (2025 est. $3.60/share), NIM tailwinds from Fed cuts, and de novo momentum. Risks moderated by pristine credit (vs. NYCB/CRE blowups). Moderate risk appetite fits: beta 1.1, 40% Tier 1 capital.  

**Estimated Fair Value: $52 (15% upside)**  
DCF-based (10% WACC, 3% terminal growth) using Q3 data + analyst consensus (avg PT $49 from 7 analysts, high $58). Hold below $48; add on dips. [Sources: Yahoo Finance consensus Oct 25; KBW/analyst updates]
